question: Question_03_(a)
statement:
\textbf{Short-Answer Questions}. Question 1-3 are short-answer
questions. Put your answer in the box provided. \textbf{Simplify your
answer as much as possible}. Full Marks will be awarded for a correct
answer placed in the box. \textbf{Show your work}, for part marks.

Evaluate

\[\int_1^3 (2x-1)e^{x^2-x} \,dx\]
sols:
Using substitution,

\begin{align*} u & = x^2-x \\
du & = (2x-1) \,dx \end{align*} and the bounds change

\begin{align*} x=1 & \Rightarrow u = 0 \\
x=3 & \Rightarrow u=6 \end{align*} Then

\begin{align*} \int_1^3 (2x-1)e^{x^2-x} \,dx & = \int_0^6 e^u \,du \\
& = e^u\big|_0^6 \\
& = e^6 - 1 \end{align*}
hints:
Always try a simple integration first, possibly with a nice
substitution.
Don't forget to change the bounds of integration!
